title: Forcing Step Attachment
intro: An individual Step can be set as required to force users to respond to it prior to moving on. Similarly, a Template can be built to force users to attach some more information to a Step. This can take the form of rich content such as a picture, a voice/text memo or even a video. Regardless of the type of Step, there might be cases where you would like an operator to take a picture upon reassembly of a machine. Forcing a Step attachment will enforce this, in just a single click.

blocks.content: In the Template Editor, go ahead and open a new side panel from the top right hand corner.

blocks.caption: Toggling a required Attachment is as simple as toggling the desired media type. More than one type of media can be toggled and required by the User at runtime.

blocks.content: To enable a particular media, simply click on it to open the Step Information side panel and toggle the desired media on and off. In this case, a picture would have to be attached to this Step in order to be able to move on.

blocks.caption:
Forced Step Attachment on the web
The required Attachments are clearly indicated below the Step title and Input in orange. Clicking the icons will allow the User to quickly attach the a media to the Step, creating a Log.

Forced Step Attachment on mobile devices
A user running a Template with a required attachment, will be reminded in three locations about the requirement. On the Runtime Template Table, the view is very similar to the above image for the display on the web.
